@graph.name: RIP Halloween Dessert Shooters - Happy Foods Tube
@graph.description: These RIP Halloween dessert shooters are perfect for your Halloween party. Oreo pudding soil, chocolate grave stones & royal icing RIP inscription.

@graph.name: Julia | Happy Foods Tube
@graph.description: I will show you that cooking and baking from scratch can be quick, easy and delicious!

@graph.name: RIP Halloween Dessert Shooters
@graph.description: These RIP Halloween dessert shooters are perfect for your Halloween party! Oreo pudding soil, chocolate grave stones & royal icing RIP inscription!
recipeIngredient: 1 packet Pudding Powder (of your choice (1.4 oz/43 g))
2.1 oz Semisweet Chocolate (or Dark Chocolate (60 g))

recipeInstructions.text: Scrape the white filling from each Oreo cookie and place it in a bowl. Set it aside. Now put all the Oreo's in a food processor and process for a few seconds to achieve crumb like texture.
recipeInstructions.name: Scrape the white filling from each Oreo cookie and place it in a bowl. Set it aside. Now put all the Oreo's in a food processor and process for a few seconds to achieve crumb like texture.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the pudding using packet instructions. While still hot, stir in the Oreo filling. Mix well. Let it cool down a bit before pouring into small glasses. Fill only ½ of each glass – you will need space for the Oreo crumbs and gravestone which will push the pudding up. Place the glasses in the fridge.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the pudding using packet instructions. While still hot, stir in the Oreo filling. Mix well. Let it cool down a bit before pouring into small glasses. Fill only ½ of each glass – you will need space for the Oreo crumbs and gravestone which will push the pudding up. Place the glasses in the fridge.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile: Melt the chocolate and butter over a pot of simmering water. Cut each ladyfinger in half. Using a spatula, spread the melted chocolate over each ladyfinger. Place them onto a sheet of baking paper. Let the chocolate set.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile: Melt the chocolate and butter over a pot of simmering water. Cut each ladyfinger in half. Using a spatula, spread the melted chocolate over each ladyfinger. Place them onto a sheet of baking paper. Let the chocolate set.

recipeInstructions.text: For homemade royal icing/frosting mix egg white with sifted powdered sugar until smooth. To do this use a fork (for best results, beat the egg white with the fork first. This will take only a few seconds. Your egg whites will look foamy). Transfer the icing into a ziplock bag and cut a tiny hole in one of the corners. When the chocolate is set, write RIP on each ladyfinger.
recipeInstructions.name: For homemade royal icing/frosting mix egg white with sifted powdered sugar until smooth. To do this use a fork (for best results, beat the egg white with the fork first. This will take only a few seconds. Your egg whites will look foamy). Transfer the icing into a ziplock bag and cut a tiny hole in one of the corners. When the chocolate is set, write RIP on each ladyfinger.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the pudding has set a bit, top it with Oreo crumbs and stick the ladyfinger inside. Store in the fridge until ready to serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the pudding has set a bit, top it with Oreo crumbs and stick the ladyfinger inside. Store in the fridge until ready to serve.
